availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joel W. Ridgell (Barboursville, Knox county, Kentucky, attorney and Lieutenant Colonel (U.S.A.))

body.p: Barboursville, Knox County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier (U.S.A.). Kentucky native. Married Sarah M. Auzier Ridgell in Floyd County, Kentucky on February 18, 1862. Father of William Ridgell. Minister in Fleming County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Barbourville, Knox County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the Seventh Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as Lieutenant Colonel from September 22, 1861 to c1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 675. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Barbourville, p. 46. “Early Floyd County,” Kentucky Marriage Records: From the Register of the Kentucky Historical Society, reprint (Baltimore, MD: Genealogical Publishing Co., Inc, 1983), 201 (accessed via ancestry.com).Find A Grave, "Joel Washington Ridgell (April 11, 1815- May 7, 1868)," Memorial #75090654, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/75090654 (accessed June 21, 2019).Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 748.
